unit.utterance: Atti: mi ti ta Alicia, nanguma ami ta melellayat a uma mi.
unit.utterance_translation: When we were in Alisiya, we (used to) cultivate our large fields.

unit.utterance: Unadda, nangay ami ti amaku, nanginsun, nantangad i langit,
unit.utterance_translation: While we (including) my father went to weed and it became at noon,
unit.add_comments: ti ama=ku is an appositive subject NP, indicating a salient member of the referents. Literally 'We, including my fathers', meaning 'My fathers and others'.

unit.utterance: tittutttud tèn ti way bubbuntun. Numangay tèn tinumuttud ti buntuni, pa:nginsun ti amaku.
unit.utterance_translation: I was sitting on the anthill. I went to sit down on the hill, while my father was weeding.

unit.utterance: Nasungdu nanginsun ti amaku, ta malu:tèp, dinumigdig ami, napaditèng de: tèn.
unit.utterance_translation: After my father finished weeding in the afternoon, we arrived (home), and I got sick.

unit.utterance: Meddègès i ulu ku y, meddègès i ragaw u y, meddègès i sapang ku y.
unit.utterance_translation: My head was painful, my chest was painful, and my back was painful.

unit.utterance: Ta awan di te: tèn napa:tumatumar di tèn ta ta'lu a biyungèt,
unit.utterance_translation: Since I did not take medicine for three nights,

unit.utterance: awan te: mapili paditèng u y.
unit.utterance_translation: my disease was not removed.

unit.utterance: Manga:na ti amaku, "mangay ita ta ospital yangay ita d ta ni mangantu:law ya ta Echuage.
unit.utterance_translation: My father said: "we will go to the hospital and I will bring you to the doctor in Echuage.

unit.utterance: Nyangaydidtènta, nipadoktor.
unit.utterance_translation: They brought me to there, to consult a doctor.

unit.utterance: Patturkan di ta a:gas ayti tallipi a sapang u, ayti ba:lag ni buli ku y, ayde: ti abaga ku, ayti, tallip a abaga ku.
unit.utterance_translation: They injected medicine into both sides of my back, into the flesh of my buttocks, and both of my upper arms.

unit.utterance: Unaddad, tallip di bulan ku d, mere:re:teg de: tèn a permi. Awan de: ta pu:lupulugdi a:yi:.
unit.utterance_translation: After two months [lit: my months (were) two], I became very skinny. There was no hair here.

unit.utterance: Nangittimbangdi a:yi: awan di ta pulupulug naka:kalbowan di ay kud i.
unit.utterance_translation: On both side of this, there was no hair of it,

unit.utterance: Manga:na ti amaku, "Umu:li itam di da awan di mapi:pi:piyanna ay take:ta amma mappati, maka'imantep ta bunbun ya." Umu:li ami d.
unit.utterance_translation: My father said "shall we go home because she has not been cured, and so if she dies, she can have a rest in that house." We came back home.

unit.utterance: Addigdig mi ti bunbunmi, numangayta koma:redi, koma:re ni amaku, koma:re ni inaku.
unit.utterance_translation: As soon as we came back home, their neighbors came there, that is, my father's neighbors and my mother's neighbors.

unit.utterance: [The speaker begins to talk in Ilokano, so the Ilokano interviewer asks her to speak Arta.]
unit.utterance_translation: [The speaker begins to talk in Ilokano, so the Ilokano interviewer asks her to speak Arta.]

unit.utterance: "Koma:re, ittan mu nen i ana:kuy. Manga:paditèng, mappati wada d."
unit.utterance_translation: "My neighbor, please look at my child. She is sick, and probably she will die."

unit.utterance: Tinala:duwande:tèn ni koma:redi, ittan di.
unit.utterance_translation: Their neighbor offered food to me (to the spirit inside me), and found out.

unit.utterance: Atti: an name:si ti sapang u y.
unit.utterance_translation: It was said that something slapped my back.

unit.utterance: Awan me:ta.
unit.utterance_translation: It is not visible.

unit.utterance: Karangètan. Pine:sinan an i sapang u y, ènsi:na minapaditèng tèn.
unit.utterance_translation: It is said that it was a small spirit. It slapped my back, so I got sick.

unit.utterance: Minapi:pi:yadtèn, awandi minapilipili ay pilèy, nagabbalin de: tèn napilèy,
unit.utterance_translation: I recovered, (but) my crippleness was not removed at all. I became crippled,

unit.utterance: da nabayag hug tèn napaditèng.
unit.utterance_translation: because, as I said, I was sick for a long time.
unit.add_comments: nabayag is formally a verb, but it always forms a complex sentence together with "main" verbs. Hence treated as an <other> adverbial here.

unit.utterance: Ènsi:na aytay, napilèy de: tèn
unit.utterance_translation: That is why, now, I became crippled,

unit.utterance: konta dyo:bèbbèlèt ta salamat tèn ta Dios namara:tu dèn, maski pilèy tèn.
unit.utterance_translation: but I thank God for creating me although I am crippled.

unit.utterance: Atti: tep i me:kari te: tèn a ti''adu'adup didi a:na: ku y, aydi: ta ta:me:ta a arta.
unit.utterance_translation: I promised to help my children and other Arta people.
